UPSHOT: YOU TURN YOUR COMPUTER/DEVICE INTO BIG BROTHER BY AGREEMENT IN THE LICENSE AT INSTALLATION, IF YOU INSTALL WINDOWS 10. Never before in history has such a 'license' created such awful terms. Look in the comments for links so you can see the language for yourself. I can't put the links in an Amazon review.

SERIOUSLY YOU NEED TO SEE FOR YOURSELF PRIOR TO INSTALLATION, WHAT HITLERIAN TERMS YOU'RE AGREEING TO.

Installation is also extremely glitchy. About 50% of the installers' reports I've read, are 'smooth', especially from Windows 8.1.. else, glitchy. Given the above warning, I spend a lot of time watching how people in tenforums, wilderssecurity forums, bleepingcomputer and even microsoft community, are suffering with installing this horrible new Windows 10. I do have it, but as an Insider. I write extensively about it in bleeping computer and vimeo PC World Alumni forum and brainout(dot)net frankforum (latter two are my own), so you can read more there. It has no confidential data on it, and the hard drive is removable.

I personally own 16 Windows machines which are eligible for this thing 'free'. So obviously if I found it good, would get it for them all, and say so here.

But Windows 10, is scary. First time, Windows is scary. You'll have to see it yourself to believe it: at least, I did. That's why I became an Insider, first.

So here, I feel I owe it to my fellow Amazonians to disclose the upshot of this awful installer:

1. It will only allow you to do a so-called 'inplace upgrade' ON TOP OF your current Window 7 or 8, which 50% of the time results in disaster. People do it, to keep their current programs and settings. Don't bet on this working. Even experts are getting it wrong, see the 1st paragraph's forums. That is also how the free version works. Just avoid this option like the plague it is.

2. The other option is 'clean install', which here is only available if purchased. But people who use this, are having really bad luck, and Windows help personnel always blame the seller, so make you go back to the seller. So here, unless the seller sells you support with the license (and they usually do not), then you shouldn't buy.

The problem with 'clean install' is the installer looks for a key. The key you are supposed to provide, is a Windows 10 key. The key you get is a Windows 10 key, but the installer often won't recognize it. When you call MSFT for help, often you're told they can't help, you must go back to the seller. So if they are not the seller, you're s.o.l.

More importantly, the license is downright frightening. It's so much worse than turning your machine into Big Brother, but Microsoft tells you that you agree to let IT play Big Brother on you, even if you turn off all the privacy destroyers baked into the thing. This is a series of lawsuits waiting to happen.

And what do you get for all this? Nothing you didn't already have. Frou-frou that doesn't work: Windows 'Hello' requires a special camera you don't have, Windows Xbox requires Xbox too, Hololens can't work yet, Cortana is a joke, Edge is a gray sheet of paper which gets papered with ads you can't get rid of, your search bar is turned into advertising if you search on the web, you can't get rid of Bing, you can't customize, there is no real Start Menu but instead a vertical version of the Win8 start Screen... and on and on with the nonsense.

Oh, and no you really can't revert within 30 days, they overwrite your windows.old folder with the first Windows 10 cumulative update. Which happens, the day or the day after, you activate. IF IF IF you managed to activate.

Do you really want to go down the rabbithole with Alice and be much poorer afterwards? I thought not.

I have been a loyal customer and bought a full version of PP10, and paid to upgrade to PP11. During the last 18 months, I upgraded my laptop twice, and then upgraded my current laptop from XP to Vista. When I downloaded the Vista version and tried to reinstall it, it says the software cannot be activated. Turns out that they only let you install the darn thing 3 times.

THAT IS SIMPLY RIDICULOUS IN THIS DAYS AND AGES. To add insult to injury, they want you to pay full price and buy another full version.

Guess what. They lost me as a customer, permanently. I uninstalled it and use the FREE Paperport that comes with my Brother All-in-one printer instead. And then, I discovered that there are actually many free Print-to-PDF products that you can download from the web, such as CutePDF, or PrimoPDF.

Don't waste time with this product!

First for Mac users: I installed this on a Mac running OS X 10.3. It asked me which version of OS X I was running and offered 10.2, 10.3, and 10.4 as options. I selected 10.3 and it went through a preliminary install. Then it asked for the serial number on the card which came with the software. (If you are as compulsive about throwing away clutter as I am, try to restrain yourself and save that card! Otherwise, I don't think the program will turn on.) After I did this and provided the usual registration stuff, it got online (I should mention I was installing in an administrator mode)and had a chat with the company. Everything went very well. This program is native for the Mac OS X and doesn't require Mac Classic or anything like that. Thanks, guys, for making such a neat piece of software that also runs on Macs!

OK, now about using the program. I am the sort of person who gets a great idea and sits down at her computer and just starts going. Things go wonderfully for about five chapters, and then I run out of steam because I just haven't thought enough about where things are going, and it's getting hard to keep everything straight.

This program is like sitting down with a no-nonsense writing teacher who asks detailed questions about characters, motivations, goals, and so on and gives you feedback on whether or not you have enough information for a workable plot stucture and what's missing. (You are free, of course, to ignore its advice.)

The most difficult part about using this program is that the designers have invented a lot of terminology that you have to understand to use the program properly. (There is a PDF file on the disk containing a 300-plus page book that explains the theory and vocabulary in detail. I strongly recommend you read it first! Once you have that, the software is quite user-friendly.)

What I found especially helpful in the software were the dozens of examples of well-known stories that theauthors had analyzed in terms of their model of plot design. That model(this is oversimplified) is the idea that a story is like a mind trying to solve a problem and that different characters are like aspects of that mind at work.

If you put in the work -- and it is a LOT of work -- at the end you will have a detailed plot outline which can be printed out.

If you can write novel-length fiction on pure inspiration, you will probably hate this. If you have good ideas, but find yourself lost in the woods and hoping for a rescue party after about fifty pages, this can be a lifesaver. You get out of it as much as you put into it.

I have just upgraded from 2005 (which I loved) to 2006 with a clean install of 2006 to avoid problems. Read the manual, did everything correctly. It installed just fine. The 2nd day I am unable to open more than one large application at a time, such as Outlook and Firefox both at once. It eats up more memory than both of these apps together. * The Install * We tested out QB Pro 2010 by upgrading our 2009 Pro install and loading our company file. The install took about 15 minutes and retained many of our settings from QB 2009. The installer did hang at the end hand had to be killed with task manager (Win XP). * First Run * After installing, we ran QB 2010 and it needed to download an update. This process took about 10 minutes, and then it needed to convert our company file to the new format. Not a big deal, but don't try to load a file from QB 2010 on previous versions--backwards compatibility is lost. Actually running the program, we find some minor updates, as well as many familiar old annoyances. The toolbar is again littered with icons for Intuit products we're not interested in (we had cleaned this up when we installed 2009). The Intuit Community pops up, but you can disable it in preferences. The interface is littered with Intuit products they want you to buy. For example, there is an item \\"Email Marketing\\" in three separate menus, Company, Customer, and Online Services. We tried this menu option and it complained that IE was not our default browser. (Duh, it's called security.) * Summary * QuickBooks Pro 2010 is a minor update (the new company snapshot is nice, the new products they're trying to sell you are not) feature-wise. The software works well enough to tolerate and everybody uses it. Accountants know it. This is why we use it. We wish there was another option for us as Intuit is not a customer-friendly company in our opinion. They try to hard to get you to pay for minor features that should be included. They should spend more focus on the customer experience and let the revenue streams follow, not vice versa.

Poser wasn't quite what I expected. I thought it would be very focused on figures, human and otherwise; but in fact, it's a surprisingly full-featured 3D rendering program.

As far as sample content goes, yes, there's quite a lot of it, and it's surprisingly varied. Once I'd put together a quick scene of a wolf eating potato chips, I decided to see whether I could pull in 3D models downloaded from the Internet. Happily, the answer is yes--Poser will read a number of common 3D file formats, so you can trawl the Internet for free models of sci-fi spaceships, Japanese Manga characters, or whatever else you want to incorporate into your artistic endeavors.

Obviously there are lots of things you can't do with Poser. It doesn't give you complete control over rendering, and it's not a solid modeling package or NURBS mesh editor. But it'll give you the chance to make some images or animations, and see if you're ready to go further.

The thing is, I've toyed with various free 3D tools over the years, from POV-Ray to Blender. Poser has almost all of them beat as far as UI approachability is concerned, and with the sample content and tutorials is an excellent place to start if you have an interest in 3D graphics. Yet even without an unapproachable interface in the way, I've come to realize that 3D is really hard and very time consuming to get just right. I don't think it's for me. But it could be for you, and here's a way to find out.

I have been using the product for over a month and half and just now am I finally experiencing noticeable results. My ability to hold and manipulate information in my head is better. For example, Math is coming to me much easier. I've noticed that I need to write out my problems less and can finish them in my head. This is great for me because just two 2 years ago I dropped out of calculus but now Im doing fine. Another thing, for the longest time I hit a wall with my reading speed (I bought sofware for that too) but now that is starting to increase once more. The best way to describe it is that things are growing clearer.

Now for the bad. The software is very basic. For most, the exercises will probably too boring to do every day. This has been my experience trying to get friends to use it. And in my opinion, ten minutes a day isn't enough. I've been using for about an hour a day. The way I look at it is there will always be a diet that works or a method that gets you rich or a philosophy that makes you happy and there will always only be a few individuals that have the drive to become better. Without being too preachy, this software is for the individual that understands the importance of intelligence in succeeding at life and has the drive to do something about it.

Edit: It has been 3 years since using the program. Now that I am aware of what is out there and free websites that offer similar brain training, the price is too expensive to justify purchasing. Dual-n-back, a short term memory training program, has been more effective and more importantly there are free versions available. Another name to look up is Harry Kahne and his coarse in Multiple Mentalism. Both programs are very rigorous but produce results over time.

I used Visio for years (several years ago) but migrated to web-based diagramming solutions like Gliffy, Diagramly, Flowchart, Bubbl, and Mindomo for all of my diagramming needs. I can honestly say that SmartDraw is worth every penny if you spend any time at all working on flow charts or diagrams. I've used Maximizer off and on since the 80's. Sometimes I've used other things because I hoped \\"something better\\" would come along (Like Outlook finally growing up, or ACT! getting its act together. I've kept coming back to Maximizer simply because it does more, and does it better. The drawback to Maximizer is that there is little \\"if you are a ________, do things this way...\\" kind of information. There are basically 4 was to approach the system on a day to day basis, and a user needs to decide which approach is their best one and stick with it. One can manage the information by person (like ACT!) or by Company or by sales Opportunity or by Tasks. These are not mutually exclusive -- you can do all of these things simultaneously, its just best to pick one to be your perspective on life! For example, if your perspective is \\"individual person\\" then be assured you can start with a person and easily manage all related documents, conversations, emails, to-do items, opportunities, appointments, calls, etc. for that person. If you are managing opportunities, you can likewise easily manage all the people, documents, calls, etc. The most powerful part of Maximizer is that it can fit into YOUR sales process. The most difficult part of Maximizer is that it expects YOU to have the process for it to adapt to. Success with Maximizer is all about having a process. If you have one -- this system will maximize it beautifully. (Current version is 9)

For a long time I was an enormous fan of Adaptec and their Easy CD Creator program. The name truly says it all; \\"EASY!\\" This program is so user-friendly, never crashed on me and never burned me a frisbee. When I purchased my first CD burner it came with version 4.0 (I think that was the version number). Some time ago I purchased the Platinum edition at full price because I enjoyed the earlier version that came with my burner. I installed Platinum and was in heaven! This thing is loaded.
Now I know that most of you reading this haven't gotten past my initial remark that, \\"for a long time I WAS and enormous fan...\\" If you're wondering how a program that seems to be so user friendly, so loaded with options, so stable and so well designed could lose the admiration of a long time fan, I'll tell you.
A few months back I purchased a new TDK CD burner. The burner came with Nero 5.0 burning software. I had heard of Nero but was completely unfamiliar with it. I installed it and hated it. It was not half as user-friendly as Easy CD Creator and that part frustrated me. I read that Nero was also loaded with cool features but the problem was, I couldn't figure out how to work them. The help screens in the program were lame and it came with no manual. Frustrated I returned to my Easy CD Creator program and installed it again. Something terrible then happened; neither programs would work right. Things started to crash. I browsed the Net to find answers and discovered that Nero and Adaptec absolutely cannot co-exist on the same machine. This fueled my hatred for Nero even more. Eventually I had to completely re-format my hard drive and start over. This time I installed Adaptec exclusively. But then I discovered something else. My new burner was NOT supported by Adaptec and so nothing worked quite right. I re-formatted again and installed Nero. I was hacked (in the \\"mad\\" sort of way, not that I was actually hacked, physically or electronically - ok, just a brief point of clarification there for our viewers)! But if I was ever going to be able to burn CD's with my new burner I knew that I would have to learn Nero.
To make a long story short, I discovered the joy of Nero! It is a fantastic program and, in my opinion, it's much better than Adaptec software any day! The only gripe I have is that it is not as user friendly, however the options and features are fantastic! You just have to commit some time (and a few frisbees) to figure out what the heck you're doing.
But there's more to the reason why I so dislike Adaptec now. Over time I have discovered that a lot of the CD's created with Adaptec do not operate well on all other computers or audio devices. In fact, some CD's I'd made with Adaptec caused Windows to crash when I tried to access them on other computers. Since I started with Nero, and put the effort into learning how to use it properly, it is so much better! I have yet to see a machine that rejected a disk I made with Nero, but Adaptec flopped often. I think the reason why I didn't notice the problems with Adaptec for so long is because I was predominantly playing and accessing disks made with Easy CD Creator on machines that also had Adaptec.
Adaptec software has a lot of fantastic features and they are easy to use and the program comes with a great manual! I will say that the VCD maker works nicely and burning a regular audio CD works well. If this is predominately your usage intentions then you will be happy with the program. However, when it comes to making things like MP3 CD's or even just data CD's you may be in for some headaches. Not necessarily if your burning them and using them on the same system, but if you try to use the disk on another computer without Adaptec software, or sometimes even with it, you might discover what I'm talking about.
Anyway, all of that to say that there are positives and negatives about this program. Perhaps your experience will be different. I just know that I really dig Nero now! Granted, it was a bit of a headache to learn how to use (and some features I am still learning how to use), but it is very stable and makes perfect copies of anything. You will just have to determine what's more important to you; ease of use or actually being able to use what you created. For me the latter won the coin toss! Good luck!

I generally think of Acrobat as a product to make PDF files, but this is so much more. Basically if you want to make good looking content that can be viewed on a computer, in print of online, Acrobat Pro is what you want. frankly, it's way too much for me to utilize to its full potential, but if you are big into graphics programs, you'll want to give this a try.
not as good as 2007 version!

I love Norton security programs for PCs. This cheapest version of the security available from Norton is sufficient to protect your PC from many threat. They update and counteract quickly to any new threat as soon as they are known. I had couple times it said that it blocked and removed some threat from attacking my PC. It updates quite often, and I was able to upgrade for free for 2011 version when it became available. For this price and protection, it is a bargain. The security center has all the information at a glance, and it has computer, web, and network protection. It has the function to improve the PC performance, online family protection, and free online backup.

My experience falls under the category of naive buyer beware.

While I did a fresh install on an existing drive (MacBook), I was ignorant of the fact I was not buying a retail product. I had searched on Windows 7 at the Amazon retail site. I did not understand what I read. My mistake, not that of OutletPC.

From the vendor:

System Builder (OEM) cannot be used to validate an existing copy of Windows, or to upgrade from another Operating System. You have to do a fresh install on a new computer, or format the Hard Drive on an existing system, then reload the Operating System from scratch.

From the Manufacturer
Use of this OEM System Builder Channel software is subject to the terms of the Microsoft OEM System Builder License. This software is intended for pre-installation on a new personal computer for resale. This OEM System Builder Channel software requires the assembler to provide end user support for the Windows software and cannot be transferred to another computer once it is installed. To acquire Windows software with support provided by Microsoft please see our full package \\"Retail\\" product offerings.

I tried to load this program several times without success. Finally, I read the fine print and found that my computer did not meet the minimum requirements needed to run the program. These requirements were not posted up front on the Amazon sale page. I was very disappointed. Love Amazon, but this was a misstep.

The only problem I've had so far is that during activation for the video component of the bundle, you have to enter an organization name in order to proceed with the software installation, since the other components didn't require such an input, i had to call customer support thinking something was wrong with my product key, they told me to just put the letter A in the organization field and it would let me proceed. I used my initials instead and sure enough it worked and continued installation just fine. The whole bundle has been an exceptional value, I unfortunately haven't had enough time to get really in-depth with the video software, but as the interface and \\"demo\\" projects show, it looks great. Why pay 4-8 times the price for adobe or final cut, this software package is great for beginners and advanced users alike, you can use wizards or create your own components with professional accuracy and claims to support HD, blu-ray, and AVCHD. Again, highly recommended, I wish i could get Corel's Draw Suite for as low a price as this one (I got this on sale for $50) cause i tried the demo of that suite and it was also a great bang for the buck.

I ordered 4 of these for 2 thermostats, and the setup and install for the first two was a breeze. There are some limitations as to how the thermostat will use the thermostats temperature, but thats really a problem with the thermostat, not this product. However, for the other two I had problems. During setup, the unit kept giving me an orange light, when the manual only mentions either a green or red light. Even if I assumed that the orange light was supposed to mean "red," that didn't make sense. Red indicates a dead battery, and I used several fresh sets of batteries. I never could get one unit to install. I contacted Honeywell support, and since this is supposed to be a contractor installed item, they will not help. If you do purchase this item, make sure you install it immediately. That way if it doesn't work, you can just return without having to deal with honeywell support. There are reports that these units might work initially, but fail/stop connecting to thermostat in a year or so, so that is still a concern you must deal with.

I also bought a pack of "PilotLights Adhesive Wire Clip for cable management, cable organizer" which gave me enough sticky clips to make the wiring manageable and look professional. The pack comes with three 3' connector cables, which I found just about right for a 34" wide display cabinet. So far so good. Highly recommended.

I BOUGHT THIS FLAPPER BECAUSE I WANTED TO USE THE LEAST AMOUNT OF WATER PER FLUSH. NOT ONLY DOES THAT SAVE WATER BUT IT TAKES LESS TIME FOR THE TANK TO FILL UP. IT WORKED GREAT FOR ABOUT A WEEK OR TWO AND THEN I NOTICED IT STARTED TAKING LONGER AND LONGER FOR THE TANK TO FILL UP. WHEN I TOOK THE TANK COVER OFF I NOTICED THE FLAPPER WAS STAYING UP LONGER LETTING MORE WATER OUT OF THE TANK WITH EACH FLUSH.

THERE IS A PART ON THE FLAPPER THAT YOU CAN ADJUST TO DETERMINE HOW LONG THE FLAPPER STAYS UP. BUT GRADUALLY OVER A WEEK OR TWO THIS PART SHIFTS ON IT'S OWN. UNLESS YOU ENJOY ADJUSTING YOUR TOILET FLAPPER EVERY FEW WEEKS, I WOULD AVOID THIS PRODUCT.

Lasted 7 years on my deck and color still good! Like the other reviewer I don't get all the negative comments here. I had my handyman put this on my silvered, wearing badly deck with full, west/south sun exposure in SC 7years ago. He properly cleaned and prepped the deck and had recommended this noting the cost was worth it.

It not only turned the silvered, rough boards a lovely pale cedar color (1/2 natural + 1/2 cedar mix). It also lasted until this to year when my deck had gotten very dirty and algae'd with the SC moisture and humidity. Just got the deck power washed this week to get all dirt and grime off. It's clean now and really surprisingly the deck boards are back to the nice cedar color! Amazing as I did literally no maintenance in 7 years.

I'm now buying a couple more gallons to refresh it and re-seal again and expect another 7 years. Worth every penny just not to have to resell/stain deck every 2 years like I did in my prior home when I used Behring or Thompson stain and seals. Highly recommend this stuff!

These LED strips have their ups and downs.

It seems this is a common problem I've seen when buying these strips. The first 12v power cable interface is solid but the 2nd one (that's included in the package) seems to be either broken or on the point of breaking. Not to mention that i got my packages somewhat damaged which didn't affect the LEDs but could have caused damage with the power cables.

Remember this: These are "sticky" strips and, if you don't go over them and keep pressing them down (the first few days) they may actually come loose. And whatever you do, make sure there is NO stress where the cable is connected or it will pull loose. An alternative might be "stapling" them into place where the power cables are attached to ensure they will not come off whatever surface they are attached to.

How these units respond to very hot weather....I'm not there yet but they don't seem to lose their adhesiveness during cold weather. I'm in Alabama so summers don't get much more hot/humid here so i will update this in a few months.Still, as an alternative lighting source, i have to admit...these aren't bad.

I would guess that if someone could develop a USB connector with a wireless switching system (or just toggle switches) this could make any RV, or possibly even a man-cave look really nice.. It's all about the direction they are being used and the angles. Also, having them project onto a "white" back surface has a much nicer effect.

Oh, you might want to limit their burn period to a maximum of 16 hours, those 12v adapter get pretty HOT when the LEDs have been used for a long period of time.

And, by the way, do NOT try to run 2 strips on one 12v adapter...you will probably get a burnout in 12-18 hours. Already made that mistake in hopes of getting two for one...won't work.

I know people are planning on using these in cars but you had better make sure they are secure because, if they fall, and are kicked or dragged, they won't endure it. Tough is something these LEDs are not meant to be.ause, if they fall, and are kicked or dragged, they won't endure it. Tough is something these LEDs are not meant to be.

As many others reported, this blanket, which claims it will fit around a 50 gallon tank, doesn't wrap completely around it. The tank is in a newer townhouse I bought, which I plan to move to after other work is completed inside. So, I looked it up on Amazon and as others stated, it doesn't fit many tanks and there isn't enough tape to completely seal the seam either. What's the point of not enclosing enough tape to seal the seam? Just so we have to buy a roll of some sort of tape to finish the job?

I measured the circumference of the tank before buying a blanket for it, so I thought I had the correct product. How can this company claim it fits around one when it doesn't? So I measured the width of the blanket, and yes, it's the size stated, so not sure why it doesn't fit the tank. Luckily, I bought this at a local hardware store, to which I returned it, with no hassle, but the store didn't have anything else in stock, so I left without a water heater blanket. I then tried both HDs and the Lowe's stores in my city, but the only ones they had were the same thing, or nothing on the shelves. I guess they had sold out.

Upon doing extensive research now, I've decided that a fiberglass blanket that's so thin, isn't going to be enough added insulation to make my water heater much more efficient (trying to reduce stand-by loss). So I'm looking for a thick mineral wool blanket instead. Mineral wool is both waterproof and more fireproof than this piece of junk.

Remember to insulate your water pipes as much as possible too. I know that's difficult in a finished home, but do what you can.

Funny how some simple things make us happy. I have a 1950's built house and have replaced some of the plumbing and added to some sections. Installation is super simple with PEX a crimper and the collars, even in a tight crawl space. Just ordered a few more for future projects. And as compared to the original plumbing / valves ... they made things really great in the 50's, but way to complicated ... this is a simple ball valve that is built really well whereas the original is built really well but has multiple seals, 5 turns to turn on or off, junctions etc ...

It's funny how you end up doing some of the things you do...this is a perfect example. I had been given a couple of smaller Lava Lites left over from a TV commercial, and as a goof we put one on top of a subwoofer in our home theater off to the side of the screen. My wife and I would catch ourselves staring over at it on commercials or during bad TV episodes or films. So when I found out there was a BIG A** version of it I just had to one-click it on Amazon.

We have had a BALL with this thing-literally! We got the yellow and purple based on other reviews-It does have an excellent contrast of the colors, though I think it's kind of a drag not to be able to buy additional colored bottles once you have the base unit. Did I mention it is BIG?? NOT 250 ounces like the ad (That's almost 2 Gallons!)- The bottle is actually 57 ounces, so about the size of a two-liter bottle- a little wider on the bottom and and around 4\\" taller because of the cone effect of the lamp shape. Patience is a virtue here; it does take over two hours to heat up to the point where it's dripping red ball shapes. Up until that time the wildest Formaldehyde Baby, hydrogen bomb cloud, Area 51 alien, and cellulite fat looking shapes ever imagined form at all levels of the lamp-which is cool on its own! And the amount of activity once it's fully warmed up is awesome as well- it's so big inside that seeing 6, 10, or more balls dripping while large ghost shapes are behind is common. As other reviews have said, make sure you center the lamp-another advantage is with this size one being so tall the actual bulb for the lamp is far enough off the base that you don't need to worry as much about heat damaging veneers underneath. We keep it on a black Paridigm sub for six hours with no signs of damage, but you're on your own here for your use. And the sub if if anything seems to help the experience. And we heeded the advise of another good reviewer and we do limit the total time to six hours, not the eight the one-sheet that comes with it says.

Over a month now, and running 2-3 days a week, it's been fantastic. This is a blatant trick by Amazon to make me go buy SACD's of Dark Side of the Moon, Goodbye Yellow Brick Road, and a few other classic 70's LP's... and it WORKED! A great talking point, stress reliever, and reason to get slightly altered and turn up the volume. Highly Recommended!

We were pleased with the quality and price of the faucet we received; however, our experience in dealing with the technical service department at Kingston Brass (George) was disappointing. They were they were hard to reach, were unpleasant on the phone, and did not seem to care one bit about helping us with our issue. They also sent our part later than promised - even though we paid for 2nd day shipping - which caused delays in our bathroom renovations. Speaking with a Kingston supervisor did not amount to anything either.
In addition, we ended up ordering a part from our local plumbing shop over a month ago, who received twice the wrong part from Kingston Brass. We have yet to be able to use our brand new Kingston faucet.

Our conclusion is that Kingston products are high in aesthetics; however, we will certainly hesitate in purchasing future Kingston products because of their lack of customer care.

I have a wall heater vent that is about 40 feet from the furnace. The contractor that put in the bedroom addition decided to connect the duct to the end of a duct that already feeds two other rooms. In the past, I had to close the other two vents in order to feel any appreciable flow out of the end vent, and still the room was much colder than the rest of the house.

Although this model is described as white in color, the booster that I received is closer in color to the gray outlet- and switch plates. As others have mentioned, it is somewhat loud, and removing the inner grates helped to some extent. On closer inspection, I found that one of the fans would not spin freely. I discovered that both fans were not assembled correctly. Specifically, the fan bearings were not pressed fully into the hub. When I looked at the gap between the fan (the rotating part) and the frame, I could see the coils of copper wire inside. Supporting the hub, I pressed each fan down until it seated fully. The blades sit much closer to the hub support arms. I noticed that both fans spin much more freely and the booster is noticeably quieter.

The fans are model DFC902512M by coolingfan.cn, 12VDC, 0.20A. This model is not listed on their website, but a similar 92x92x25mm, 12VDC, 0.20A model listed has the following specifications: voltage: 6-13.8VDC, speed: 2500rpm, airflow: 48.1cfm, pressure: 2.60mmH2O, noise: 31dBa, weight: 77g. Tach measurements give the following fan speeds: low: 2000rpm, medium: 2200rpm, high: 2500rpm. At medium speed, the noise level seems comparable to that of the unboosted vents closer to my furnace. There is a more significant jump in speed and noise from medium to high than low to medium. I use medium.

While the unit was open, I also desoldered the thermistor from the control board and extended it with a pair of wires by about 8 inches out the back. I was able to thread the two thin wires through the original hole for the thermistor and out of one of the rectangular access holes for the fan catches without the need for drilling an additional hole. The thermistor now sits deeper inside the duct. The unit no longer cycles on and off repeatedly at the start and end of the heater cycle due to the fan blowing directly on the thermistor. There is no hysteresis programmed into the controller, so the fans cycle on and off at exactly the set temperature.

The LEDs for the indicator panel fit into tubular guides. You can inserted a small wad of cotton or tissue into each tube to dampen the amount of light emitted, and not alter the external appearance of the booster.

The booster comes with a 12VDC, 500ma transformer-type wall wart. According to my Kill-a-Watt meter, it is drawing 1W at idle, 5W on low, 6W on medium, and 7W on high. Note that the fans are rated 2.4W each according to the labels, 4.8W together. When power is reset, the booster seems to remember the last-used settings.

This booster fits best if the duct opening is flat and square. In my case, the metal duct extends slightly from the drywall and the spackling is uneven. Due to this protrusion and the design of the plastic faceplate and adapter, the unit does not sit flush against the surrounding drywall. I will have to either trim the duct and spackling flush with the drywall, or adhere a strip of thin foam insulation around the perimeter of the back of the faceplate to close this irregular gap.

The room is warmer and comfortable with the booster installed and running. Considering the quality of parts and type of materials used, I do wish it was a little less expensive. I also had to order the adapter plate for larger vents, plus a 120VAC flat-plug extension cord so that it can be plugged into a wall outlet behind furniture. However, it is relatively simple device that can be completely disassembled and is servicable to the circuit board level with readily-available parts.

It's always somewhat surprising to pull out an old furnace filter and see how much dust it has collected over a few months. My particular system uses a 2" x 20" x 20" filter -- a size that is not readily available from the "big box" home centers. This proved to be a blessing in disguise, as it caused me to research what "MERV" meant -- and I discovered that the filters carried by local vendors were of rather low quality in the level of filtration. As an allergy sufferer, I was pleased to be able to purchase a higher level of filtration that should reduce the allergens moving though my home's air handling system. These filters appear to fulfill my needs very well and were quite reasonably priced.

In my home, the furnace is in the attic, and the filter is positioned just behind a grill in the ceiling of a central hall. The measurements of filters tend to be slightly less than the nominal measurement, which made installation a 'three hand' situation. (Solved by turning on the system fan, allowing the air flow to hold the filter in place while closing the grill that holds the filter in place.) The filter does not firmly contact the sides of the filter box, but the duct behind the filter is slightly smaller, so that in operation, the air pressure holds the filter against the duct giving an adequate seal.

The filter appears to be sturdy and should preform its task without structure failure.

This cart is a must have if you own the 110lb MK-101Pro or similar saw. It makes transporting much easier. Previously I had to dissassemble the saw into two pieces plus the stand and carry each piece to or from the trailer for transport.
There is some pretty good engineering with the ATS stand but it could have been designed better, especially for the price. The legs are held in place by 1/4" bolts which I doubt will last long because of the extreme stress placed on them when raising and lowering the saw. The instructions that came with the stand showing the purchaser how to attach the saw are all but useless. The pictures are pitiful. It took me almost an hour to figure out things that with proper instruction would have taken minutes.
The pneumatic tires are secured only with an axle cap. The tire wabbles. It would not surprise me if this method of attachment doesn't fail quickly.
Other parts are the saw stand show thought and engineering. The way the legs fold out of the way is good. A stand on the end of the saw, which allows it to be placed on end ready for wheeling to or from the job site, can be removed after raising the stand into its working position and placed in slots on the side of the stand for an additional working surface. I have a 'batch' solar hot water tank on my roof I put in when I built the house in 1990. It preheats the water before it goes into a water heater, and previously I had an LP gas heater, a 40 gallon tank. That system worked well, but four years ago I did an addition and put in a Bosch solar type tankless heater designed to back up the solar hot water. It works very well, sensing the temperature of the water coming from the roof and firing up only as needed to increase the temperature if the water from the batch heater isn't hot enough. While it works perfectly there are two concerns. One is that the solar unit has a standing pilot light rather than electronic ignition; I believe they could figure out how to fix this. Secondly, the unit is small and if someone upstairs calls for hot water while I am in the shower the water gets cold until I adjust the mix, then the water is hot enough. This heater will not work for a large family, though putting in two might work. It has saved a lot of money in LP gas, and I have noticed the reduction since putting in the Bosch compared to the previous method. I can't say how much because I used to use LP gas to cook and when I did the addition we switched to an electric stove, so the gas use would have been reduced anyway. Still, I use very little LP gas on a yearly basis, only 200-300 gallons for home heating and water heating for a 2700 sq. ft. house; not bad!

Some of the best cyanoacrylate glue ("super glue") I've ever used.

As a bit of background, I am sometimes called upon to 3D print costume elements for friends and family for parties and such. Because of this, I print a lot of stuff with ABS. It's durable, glues together well, and can be smoothed down with acetone. But for larger elements like helmets, I have to print them in multiple pieces and glue them together.

Anyway, one day I ran out of glue mid-project. I bought some of this brand at a local store, tried it, and it worked better than any super glue I had used before. I returned to the store, bought them out, and ordered a bunch more here on Amazon.

Now, so you get the best mileage out of it, some information on cyanoacrylate glue:
How cyanoacrylate glue does *not* work:
* "Drying."
* Melting the plastic on the two sides together.
* Evaporating.
* Pretty well any other method of bonding you've ever heard about for it.

How cyanoacrylate glue *does* work:
* In the presence of water, liquid super glue polymerizes. In other words, the individual molecules of super glue plastic which make up the liquid form bond to each other in long chains and turn into a solid plastic. This solid plastic is what holds the two sides together.
* Blowing on a cyanoacrylate glue works because the moisture in your breath kicks off the polymerizing/solidifying. Touching it with your skin also works due to the moisture in your skin, but this is a very bad idea since cyanoacrylate glue has no problems bonding to skin.
* Spraying cyanoacrylate glue with water also very quickly kicks off solidifying, but you may not get as good of a joint as if you let it dry a bit slower.
* Because you're literally filling the crack with a different type of plastic, ideally you want to use as thin of a layer as you can get away with. You want to use the strength of the surrounding plastic, not try to add strength using a weaker filler plastic meant solely for bonding.
* As with any cyanoacrylate glue, keep the fumes out of your eyes. They hurt. I speak from experience many times over.

This stuff is quick drying and very strong. It holds together ABS very well. It also seems to hold PLA together pretty well, though I have less experience on that front than with ABS. But it's the best super glue I've tried.try to add strength using a weaker filler plastic meant solely for bonding.
* As with any cyanoacrylate glue, keep the fumes out of your eyes. They hurt. I speak from experience many times over.

This stuff is quick drying and very strong. It holds together ABS very well. It also seems to hold PLA together pretty well, though I have less experience on that front than with ABS. But it's the best super glue I've tried.

I saw no effects whatsoever during that month which was unfortunate. I was pretty impressed with the amount of pressure this head puts out. Though the pressure was good, it also created a sort of wind tunnel that caused my shower curtain to invade my bubble and fondle me while showering. Not pleasant. Certainly better suited for a shower or tub with a glass door. I just mentioned that the pressure was great but I must note that the pressure got increasingly strong as time passed. By the end of the month it was borderline painful which was ultimately the reason for swapping it out for something else.

They were fast on the order. It was very easy to set up, but had a little glitch getting all the components to sync with the base station. The techs were very efficient & helpful on the phone & fixed the glitch. Love feeling safer & monitored for much less than any other system.

The opener seems to work fine, BUT getting it installed was a nightmare. The directions are horrible. It required lots of other parts that only an electrician could figure out. Ended up there was no way we could install it ourselves. By the time I bought everything needed and paid for someone to install it, the whole project cost $$1,500. Not what I had in mind when I bought it. Required so many modifications and changes that were leagues beyond any of our expertise.

Order is delayed a month but now there is no option to cancel? That doesnt seem reasonable, given that this is a replacement for one of these that failed after 3 months. Price was low and 14 of 15 are still working.

Just got mine in so I have only been able to give it a test run, but it appears to do the job. If you decide to use it to clean gutters you attach the stabilizer normally as you would for a vertical wall, then move the bottom (base) of the ladder out from the wall to form the angle.

This Cosco chair has been part of my kitchen for 50 years - first as a child, and my mom still has hers. Then in my home for at least 20 years. And now I need another one - not because the old one failed but because I have another kitchen. The chair gives a good step stool, is good for at the countertop for writing, paying bills, and the kids love to sit on it doing homework. Am glad to see Cosco still makes it and Amazon carries it for a reasonable price.
I put this in our guest room which has the same coloring as the pictures. Turned out perfect! Good buy and got me out of re-paining our chocolate walls.
The purpose for which this motor was bought (replacement) has been completely fulfilled.

The lights themselves are terrific. the self stick is horrible. They will test your patience, I INSTALLED THEM ON NEW CABINETS CLEANED WITH A THINNER WIPE AND SLOWLY BUT SURELY THEY ALL CAME BACK DOWN IN TWO DAYS. GRRR I THEN PUT LOCKTITE POWERGRAB ON THEM POOF DONE. THEY POWER SUPPLY ARE NOT THE BEST BUT FOR 20 BUCKS NICE.
Installed easily and actually appeared to be of a higher quality than the blower it replaced. Has been operating for two years with no issues so far. So no complaints from me.

Arrived quickly and was well packaged. Very easy to put together- about 5 minutes each. Quite short in the seat area- on the verge of being uncomfortable. I wish that the seat was a little shorter (lower to the floor) and the back was a little higher, too. The base is quite light but feels sturdy when seated in it. I just hope that it holds up to use. Of course, I needed a small stool for my island so I guess that I got exactly what I needed.
Definitely saves water, but is a little weak for my taste. Go 1.75 and you'll be happy. Plain and simple.
Its a decent electrical outlet and cheaper here than at Home Depot.

Greenstar, who make this very good closer, also make one that's even better--it closes more smoothly: [[ASIN:B004ROJ1YG Touch'n Hold Smooth Single Kit - White]].
The closer on this page, like most of its kind, starts to close rather fast, and as you are stepping inside, may whack you on the Achilles tendon.

Greenstar has a neat video that shows how their \\"smooth\\" version reduces this problem: [...]

I have bought both closers and can confirm that the \\"smooth\\" version is much superior for this reason. It also includes the excellent step-on button to hold it open. Also available is a top-and-bottom pair which helps to ensure that the screen door closes more tightly at top and bottom: [[ASIN:B0058JLBEW Touch'n Hold Smooth Dual Kit Storm and Screen Door Closer]]
Too messy. Not precise at all and forget doing ceilings.

I bought this light to replace previous one in my bathroom that lasted for many years. This one is probably 50% larger and gives enough light to see, but is not bright enough to be annoying or disturb sleep. With the smaller light I had to use 2 when I had guests so that they could navigate, but this one is adequate on its own. I was unable to find this light retail, so I was happy to find it on Amazon.

These drawer pulls are so nice and really did give a facelift of sorts to one very old white dresser. Just be careful when you're handling them, as there is a sharp piece in the back of each pull. Once they're in place there's no danger.

I bought one of these about 5 years ago, and it worked like a charm. It finally died. I ordered a new one, and it didn't work. Got a replacement, and it didn't work AGAIN! Tried for a third, and it finally worked... Amazon was great with the return and replacement... but the Intermatic quality is REALLY iffy now. I was going to give up on it completely if the 3rd didn't work... I put it in today, and it's working - fingers are crossed. Bottomline - if you get one that works, it's an awesome switch. Easy to use, etc. But if you get one that doesn't work, good luck...

Installed this above a new shower. It was easy to install, looks great and gives a lot of light. This 4000K is typically 'cool' white, that is it doesn't have a yellowish tint. That's great for me because my shower was white subway tile and marble, so I didn't want the 'warm' color light. I probably will get another one for another shower.
This is great!!! I purchased 2 and I plug one in the basement & one on the main floor. They worked great.
Perfect for a small under-cabinet space
Pull out the old broken one and snap in the new one. Perfect replacement.

Get this system!
Easy to install. Works great right out of the box. I had no problems.

I've relocated alot because of my job. In my last 7 homes, I've installed a system from a 'traditional' security company. Over $1000 in install (or more) and then then the commit to monitoring at $40 per month.

On this house, I got the run-around so much from the 'largest local security firm' that I said "enough is enough" and tried Simplisafe. Awesome!

Took me lass than 2 hours to install and test the system. Works great!

I will never go back to the run around.

Thanks!
I love it. It is indeed space-saving product. The light is very good.

I bought this as an Xmas gift for my mom last year. It's a little smaller than I expected, and you can barely see the light in it. But it's very pretty, and has lasted a year out in the weather with no problems.
Incredible!!! Gave us so much water pressure from not much more than of a light mist from our previous one

Absolutely love it. I ended putting this up in my wife's bathroom so that if/when she forgets to turn off her curling iron I could just go in (through our Z-Wave module) and turn it off. There has been numerous times we were well on our way to a vacation and sure enough the wife had forgotten to turn of here hot hair products. This device is wonderful and works perfect with our Vera light z-wave.

Also the picture is when the unit is off. So when it's off there is a blue LED light when there is power to it there is no light.
exactly as advertised.
Works great. Adjustable.

I'm not sure it's worth what I paid, but it does get the job done. The skinny PVC support pipes are only enough to be use exactly as intended. I put a 14"-ish length piece of 3/4" copper pipe underneath before filling to allow it to drain to the center shower drain. The valves seem pretty exclusive to the pump, and the pump is pretty cheap.

I'm just so dratted grateful I can take a bath in my shower-only current living quarters.

The Pur replacement filters were the brand name and the cost was less than in stores. The faucet filter system is easy to install and the filters are easy to replace. The system flashes a green signal when filtering correctly and a red signal when it is time to replace. I would recommend this to anyone.
All four bulbs have been burning every night, all night in window electric candles since December 22 with no problems. I hope to get that many hours again next year! Not too bright blue/white color.
Used it to attach two rugs together. Works great!
I am very pleased with all aspects of this item. I use it as a towel rack in the bathroom. I would buy it again.

The bulbs are really good. A bright white that really brings out the colors in the room. These should be used for spot lighting a bit more as their angle is only 45 degrees of light. On the current dimmer, they dim fine but I only move the dimmer down about half way before they go off. Overall, a good value.
I love that this light stays on in the dark and is not motion sensitive. It also doesn't shine up into your eyes, but where you will walk. I want to see where I am going BEFORE I get there!
These have been around for some time and I've been using them for a long time. Still works fine
This size was one that I couldn't find at the local Lowe's or HD, it was just what I needed for my space available.
great received on time.

It does the job; however you can get a metal one that looks better from you big box hardware stores like Homede-poo for less. Now I have to wait for this plastic crap to wear out. Then I will replace with metal ones.
Based on an answer above, I was expecting this product to be 24 6' pieces. Instead I received a single 6' length. Unexpected given that it came directly from Amazon. Not worth gambling on.
All good
Works better than any trap I have ever used. No mess, no fuss, no mice. What's else could you ask for?
This is really cool!
Hey, what can you say about a battery. Well it works, Most important it was reasonably priced and the seller was quick as a bunny....
Only works on max setting P.O.S. Perhaps we might all slow down and cogitate on our mad rush to consumer perfection. Perhaps adversity is the grindstone of happiness? Not so awful, eh? Toodle pip.

A great deal!This Rain Showerhead is Awesome! It is so easy to install,I could do it myself. No tools are needed,you just take the old one off,put this one on and you are ready to go. This showerhead is Huge,it makes me feel like I am in a fancy hotel somewhere.The Shower Head is made with Stainless Steel so you know that it is going to last.I love standing under this,as it really does feel like you are in the rain.

I love this item. It was a bit hard to install. The instructions are not all that clear. When you attach the disposer, to the bottom ring, there is a tendency to put it too high. It doesn't come with plumber's putty and it should. Apply a generous amount of putty when placing the top ring. (see you tube videos) The disposer runs great and is quiet and very efficient. It also has a removable splash guard and the competition does not.

As advertised. Used for some tall garage cabinet doors that get used regularly and slammed thoughtlessly. They are well made and robust.
Note: Before installing them, I opened the service panel beneath the latch (access is provided by lossening a small phillips head screw) and added a drop of oil to silence a slight squeaking.
have to turn it off and on to use which is fine but I think it is more useful for a motel room door than an actual family home security item.
Easy to handle and fits in my trunk. Love it . Arrived quickly. It was great to use this for Christmas decorating.
Lights work good, just as described

Got a 4 pack a year ago and 2 died. The original incandescent bulbs lasted 7 yrs compared to theses which lasted just under a year. ROI on these do not break even. 4 bulbs saved me about 5 cents a month in electrical costs per the killawatt tool.

I love love love the thermostat itself. I have a rental home an hour from our house that we rent a few days at a time. We use this to verify the temp and reset after guests leave.
That said. The setup can be abhorrent. I'm a 30-year IT industry executive so it's not 'above' me, it's just. Finicky. I've had to setup the same stat about 6 times in the past 2 years, after power outages and most recently a wifi access point change.
Sometimes it takes moments to set up. This time took me about 3 hours spread over 4 different days. The setup would finish and then error about the auth code being invalid which leaves you with no cloud access, just local.
So. Buy it and know once installed, you'll very thoroughly enjoy it.
All Kohler products are of the highest quality. This robe hook matches the finishes of the faucets and control valves in our newly renovated bathroom. Price is reasonable - quick delivery.
nice looking, does need to be cleaned, leaves finger prints

To make my home safer for the kids, I needed light at certain areas at night, but some of the switches were placed in sub-optimal positions: too high for the kids, too far from the walking traffic etc. These motion sensor lights met my needs. I had a few requirements:
sufficient light to reduce possibility of tripping / walking into obstacle
remain switched on as long as activity was detected.
remains switched off during periods of sufficient illumination (i.e. day light)

I bought 3 pairs of 2. So far I have tested 5.
4 of the 5 worked well, and met my requirements.
1 of the 5 did not work well. It switched on even in a bright environment, and even if there was no activity.
These switches are not good quality and over time do not work. Several of my switches do not click any more and I had to replace them!

Gives a lot of light for such tiny LEDs. Exactly what my daughter wants for her college apartment. Very happy with price compared to other offerrings in the marketplace. Highly recommend this product.
Bought this here didn't think I could find it anywhere then I saw it at Walmart. It is a great product and works perfect.

This was a great replacement for the original (as the felt strip kept coming out of that one). The felt on this one protrudes a little less so presumably will stay in place far better. I've done a lot of laundry in the last 3 months since I purchased this and have seen no indication that the felt is going to pull loose, and it seems to be doing its lint-filtering job very well.
Installed and worked as expected, dishwasher is draining much better.
Great product, easy-to-use and set. Just adjust for your local son up and sundown times and it does the rest. Excellent product

would not fit the pole. can only be used on a very very small & short pole.
Your courtisy was appreciated in handeling the return.
works well but a bit over priced, as soon as I bough this found the same one near my house for half the price, it is built well and has been used many times

I wanted to use a drill pump and siphon to drain bathtubs for watering diruing our Georgia drought of 2008. On the first test, I got some water moving, so I assembled hoses and bought a cordless drill. On the second try, nothing. I tossed it. I am disappointed.
No issues. I have an Americam Standard unit that came with my house. For some reason they put Church seats on them. It was time to replace. White matches perfectly. Smooth feel. Easy installation.

This was very easy to install, and the nice thing about it is the range of where you can point the lights. This is an under the eve (not wall) installation, and so far there have been no problems with it. The sockets adjust very easily. I didn't want to spend any more than I needed to. This turned out to be just fine. I think if I was looking for something to last well into the future I might have spent more, but who knows? This could last a long time as there is very little of anything that is subject to corrosion. Very happy with it.

Because of "alienlady's" review and photos, I was worried about trying this spray. I'm glad I went with my gut. I bought the spray today, sprayed it on $3,900 worth of beadwork that had managed to get dull, forced myself to not panic over the cloudiness, and walked away for an hour. When I went back, the cloudiness had dissipated, and my beadwork was shiny and beautiful. This spray SAVED my project, and I will be able to deliver it to my client.

Purchased this unit about 4 1/2 years ago. Very please with it until just recently. Stopped running in the heat pump mode. VERY hard to find anyone to work on it. Called GE and finally was able to make an appt with a service company. The repairman arrived, expecting us to already have the part for him. GE told us HE would be bringing the part. He spent over an hour and a half trying to figure out exactly what was wrong with it, all the while on the phone with either his company tech or GE tech. So, he eventually left and had us order the part from GE. Part arrived. Called to make another appt for service. Called the day of the appt (to find out if it would be morning or afternoon when the service guy would arrive)....and was told they had no record of appt. THEN they proceeded to tell us that we were to get the part from THEM....WHY had we ordered it from GE??? AUHHHH. Made ANOTHER appt for the next day. Service guy arrives, installs the parts that GE sent us (2 fans)...still wouldnt work. After an hour on the phone with GE, they decided that the "board" was the problem. Now that is ordered and we are waiting for it to arrive, then there will be ANOTHER service call appt. Have NO IDEA how much this is going to cost us. Yes, GE covers the part in the 10 yr warranty, but not the labor. THREE SERVICE CALLS!!!

We just remodeled the kitchen (Okay, we are in process... everything that was in the kitchen is now in the living room)

The Delta Faucet we bought is fantastic, and this little gem matches the single dispenser that came with the Faucet. (Somebody explain why Delta doesn't put dispensers in for BOTH HOLES!

Pumping action is everything you'd want it to be. It's quick to prime the pump, and it pumps quantity in accordance with your hand pressure.

The bottle that holds the liquid has adequate room, but considering the difficulty involved in putting high quality dish soap and hand lotion into these bottles, they would have done well to have offered a tube that plugs into a large bottle on the floor under the sink. Short of that, it would be valuable to have received a funnel. The dispensers can be filled without removing the bottles. I don't recommend it if what you're adding is thick. It won't go in through the top. I removed the bottles and tried a funnel and was able to encourage my hand lotion to slide through the funnel neck into the bottle, by poking the dispenser "straw" through the funnel and into the bottle... many times. I'd not want to have to fill this very often. I made a mess, but now have very clean, very soft hands!

I'll solve this problem of filling the bottles and get back to you! I think it may involve water.
Required piece of equipment to run a manual air conditioner. Turns it completely off when not required, but back on again when needed!

This is the BEST system a person could ever get! I have so much control over where I place the sensors, how many I have, and what i think is important to protect. Plus NO WIRES! The only piece which needs an electrical outlet is the base station and I can decide where to place it. I ordered more display signs and extra sensors and love the fact I am not bound by a contract so I'm not wasting my money. This system is well worth the price for the peace of mind I get daily. I highly recommend this to everyone I talk to about do-it-yourself home security systems.
It doesn't sit perfectly flat on the floor and the actual toilet paper roll holder broke as soon as it came out of the package. Meh

I used the tape for a trailer ramp to cover the bare aluminum. Now I don't have to worry about
calling 911 every time I walk up this ramp. Although pricey, it's the best tape available and it sticks
very well. I'm glad I bought it and would recommend it to anyone looking for good safety walk tape.
A+

Ordered this fixture for a home office area and needed something that hung a little lower from a 9' ceiling. The brushed nickel finish matches the door hardware in the room and also the hardware on my office furniture. This gives a nice bright look and with the dimmer, I can soften the look if I wish.
The product arrived earliy, as a hard-to-find replacement for an heirloom lamp, at a fair price, in a new, pristine conditon. What more can you ask for?

I'd recommend a plumber do this install because of the potential for things to leak (just my opinion).
I don't think it's a popular item by the way the my plumber looked at it, but he noticed the metal threads in the cap and gave me his approval. Along with a quality tank, it comes with 3 filters and a tool.
I'm pleased with the results...It's been about 1 month and the filter is starting to get murky, catching all the sediment, sand, & dirt that would be going into my plumbing and appliances.
It's a small investment, but it may pay off by giving my plumbing fixtures & appliances a longer life span by keeping the dirt out...not to mention a nice pre-filter for my drinking water filter setup.
I think it should be on every home's water main (just my opinion)...
Good Product
Unit is quiet & puts out enough heat--installing it was easy enough & fairly painless....automatic in operation & simple--what else to say?
Five stars for this outlet, works just as stated and really like the fact that you can get your furniture back against the wall without having cords in the way.

I use a wrist watch for my alarm clock and this alarm is about equal in volume which is good enough for me. It gives me peace of mind during storms that require back up power for my sump pump. I was looking for an alarm and the light was a welcomed bonus.
Nothng to be said except there is 100% improvement on the tap water I get via Brita! Excellent tool.

I love this.
I cannot get my computer to recognize my iPhone 5 as a camera despite many hours researching and working with it. I was having to use my husband's computer and it was slow and unreliable (lost many videos)
This solves all those problems.
I can quickly pair my iPhone and Rav and load all my picture and videos to the sd card, then load them to my computer.
The only thing I don't like is that you don't get a thumbnail picture of the videos, just a generic icon.
I also like that I can load movies onto it to use as an external hard drive so that I don't take up valuable space on my phone.
I haven't used it as battery boost yet, but it's nice to know it's an option.
Great invention

I bought it and put it the guest bedroom. It has been used VERY minimally. One day it just wouldn't come on. My husband and I tried everything to no avail. It my opinion, it is not worth the money if it doesn't last longer than six months.
Does a great job. Wish they made a sink that was the same size but was wider than deeper.
Ok
basically it does not attach to the faucet...I don't understand why they put in the market such a bad product.
I like it
It is truly perfect. Glad I didn't have to change my locks. Multiple replacements make it even better. Good investment.
love this! better than I expected, light weight and very versatile!

Great LED replacement for 10W Halogen but they will not work with any dimmer circuits. Good warm white and very bright but they will not work with a dimmer because they contain their own AC-DC/DC-DC converter. You need to use G4 replacement that is 12V rated only for PWM dimmers to function.

I bought 3 and put all 3 of them in a new fixture. One blew when the light was turned on. I notified Amazon and a replacement was sent immediately. Love Amazon for that. But the other original two blew out after about 1 month's use. (In a light would be on for maybe 3 hours or less per day.) The "replacement" one I got is the lone remaining one functioning in the light fixture, and has been for the past 4 months, and I just haven't bothered to replace the other two that blew out so quickly. I'm reluctant to buy again from this seller because of this. Maybe I got some from a bad lot - who knows.
My daughter will love these additions to her new flower beds!
This helped my laundry area gets oraganized. It fits small spaces but can carry number of laundry stuff. Great buy.
Perfect for a faux screen door for my patio entry
This light fixutes is well made.
Took this little dude out of the box and sprayed clear and then varnnish on 20 wood chairs in less than two hours. Best investment I've made in a long time! Lightweight and works like a champ!

Quick delivery from prime allowed us to miss only a couple of dishwasher cycles. Used for our Kitchen Aid dishwasher which is 2 years old exactly.

Installation was very quick. Instructions used B&W photos that made it difficult to see whether the clips was upside down or right side up.Removing the old Adjuster was much more difficult than installing this. Came with a special screw that you attached to your screwdriver to finish off the unit.

Putting the unit back was easy enough... we're taking it easy for now.

Bought this for my jetted tub faucet. Had to really work to get it on the faucet. I also put the plumbing metal ring that you can loosen and tighten with a screwdriver over the band area to help keep it in place. I am really pleased with how well it has been working. My tab faucet is about 2" diameter.

I have been using these trash compactor bags for several years and they always hold up to whatever I shove into them. I have a family of 3 and we empty our compactor once a week (we only have garbage pick up once every week). Trust me when I tell you it is jam packed by the end of the week, and I never have an issue with blowouts, these are some strong bags. No matter what brand compactor you have, it these are the right size (I have a 15"), these are the bags you should be using. Cost effective too.

I need a pump that can fill about 90 gal a day for my irrigation system. The impeller fin broke jamming the pump and burning out the motor the first day. Would be nice if impeller was brass. Not sure if I had a defective impeller or this is typical. And no in case you were wondering there was no debris that got sucked up.
I set this thing up and now I know when someone's trying to barge in to catch me during my precious me time. It makes loud beeps for each key press, which gives me ample time to strike a pose
Not what i expected. the clock does not have a lock mechanism so not sure what the purpose of this is
This is a great keypad for a good price. I would recommend this key pad for any Marantec owners, as it does not work with other brands
Thought would be comparable to the 440i but was wrong. But overall decent machine get a lot of spray tails with 517 semigloss coats

Excellent product - sticks extremely well in the shower, even with water constantly running over it. Though, I bought my second one as the first one finally gave in after 3 or 4 years. I would say that is pretty good longevity for such a product. Highly recommended if you are looking for something that will stick nearly anywhere.
You're still able to see through it so it didn't help much on my bathroom window. It looks much darker online.
For $11 I cannot imagine this light being outshined (slight pun intended) by any other. Well made, light weight but solid - and a impressive light output.
Overall very good and easy DIY installation.
They constantly FALL off the walls!

After four months, this product has worked very well and been very reliable. It needs to be positioned in a sunny area to work best. I used it out at 1,100 ft in partial shade and it worked 90% of the time. Moving it in to about 800 ft, in full sun, it never misses a car. It is good to always know when someone is driving up the driveway. Instructions might have been clearer, but were okay. I would recommend this to a friend, may give it as a gift to others or even buy more for myself to put one further away. I only rate things that are 1 star or 5 stars and this is one of the best products I've found and I don't have to change batteries every few months.

Update: After 9 months, the product continues to work well and I'm going to buy another to help secure a portable storage building.
Exactly what I ordered, looks nice, works good and is perfect for my arthritic fingers. Moen always stands behind their products and that was a big factor in my purchase.
This stuff is amazing. it was very easy to use and it goes a long way, just this small quart can cover a lot.
This item worked perfectly. Exact fit.

These are perfect straps for tying down cargo. I use two of them for each of my kayaks, which I transport in car roof racks and "J bars." They do not have hooks or ratchets, just a simple locking buckle that holds securely, and releases only when you want it to.
This is the only type of tie-down I use, and this one is of very high quality. (I trust it to hold an $1,800 fishing kayak atop a car, traveling at 70 mph.)

My local big box stores only carry an R-2 rated insulation. This product is a bit thicker and rated R-4. Price, including shipping, is not much more than the lower quality stuff. I used an old bread knife to trim and shape it around various fittings/pipe straps, and it worked very nicely.

Got these and all my mats for all my bathrooms and kitchen. SOLO is way better than any other floor heating thermostat I've used. Programs like an alarm clock, super easy to adjust the schedule and looks clean.

I suggest buying from WarmYourFloor online, they offer the best service and support on Nuheat check them out.
This is a great broiler for two portions. Whether steaks, chops, or chicken, you do not have to get out the gigantic broiler for a healthy dinner for two. Easy to clean. Substantial feel.

This replaced the battery in my Craftsman opener, manual called for DieHard part 41B822 which is more expensive from Sears.

Opener started an incredibly annoying beeping and the console said to replace the battery. I removed the battery to stop the beeping while the replacement was in transit. This has been working fine for a week. I will update the review if I have any problems with it later.

I bought these as replacements for Redi Shades that had gotten old and slightly yellowed. I have three arched windows over rectangular windows in my garage, and they face the street. These are a perfect and very inexpensive solution to giving the windows a nice finished look.

My only complaint is that the shade of white varies from shade to shade. I got one of them measured, trimmed and in place and when I put the second one up, it was definitely a different color. The first was a very blue-white, the second a more creamy white. Good thing I'd ordered an extra and was able to get three windows covered with the more bluish-white color.

The lights are easy to install and put out a good amount of light. A lot brighter than the standard solar powered. Only problem I had, is on of the globes was broke. Wasn't too bad so I was able to glue it back together. The company that i got these through never responded to my vm about the broken globe. For the price and light output I highly recommend these. I also have 12 of the spotlights and they are really good, too.
Worked great. No idea why one didn't come with my house.
Product is amazing! Can't believe this has been out there and I have just started using it.

toto is the best toilet on the market, period. ordering it through amazon was a breeze, too. it came in a couple of days; packaged securely and was in great shape. price was way better than buying it through a local bathroom fixture showroom. installs easily, works great.

Love it! Bought the whole suite and it looks so spa-like in my bathroom. One of my favorite purchases. Looks like jewelry for the bath. Arrived when promised and it was well packaged. Would purchase again or recommend to friends.

These faucets are good quality and solid. I am keeping them because they were an excellent price. Not giving 5 stars because the design I picked is not what I received in the mail. Close enough, but irritating to pick out a pattern I liked only to be sent another one.
perfect

These timers were simple to setup and work perfectly. I used them over a holiday break to simulate someone being home and now I use them all the time to have the house lights on before I get home. It's nice walking into a nicely lit house.
Exact match at a great price and fast delivert
